title: P@C SQ: Extension of P@C for GK
description:
Description
Who is the Customer (Business Owner, stakeholder) ?
Thomas Heider
Why is the Demand needed ?
The FTTH business is becoming increasingly important in the corporate customer environment. To make this business GK-capable, the Fiber Infrastructure Construction Tool (FIB Tool) is being developed as part of the "FTTH Solution by Large Enterprise" project. This tool enables a comprehensive view of the FTTH supply situation at the customer location, also in order to be able to create offers on this basis.
What does the Customer Need ?
The currently offered PreOrder@Cloud information (TMF-645) is not sufficient for this purpose. In order to be able to avoid the connection of another data source for reasons of cost and time, we ask you to expand the existing service. The additional attributes are offered on the T-MAGIC website according to the functional interface specification "FiberAvailabilityCheck Service".
What has to be done on DigiHub PHANTOMs or its applications side to fulfill the requirements (high-level Solution Outline) ?

This is NOT part of Service Qualification! (can be orchestrated with CLM)  
  For information about subaddresses, furthe ServiceQualificationItems will be added to ServiceQualification in P@C.
They must be distinguishable from pure address information services.
In ADC this is transported via the place type and name:
Place Name = Building part ("Vorderhaus", "Hinterhaus", ..),
Place type = BuildingSection.
For P@C service qualification, the name attribute is only to find in "service" - here the name is always set to "Access" (applies to all technologies).
Introduction of a variable name value for Service:
Access --> as addressbased availability;
all other values quaracterise a subaddress and are set accordingly to the respective "Service name" of ADC:
e.g. "Vorderhaus", "Hinterhaus", "whatever".
The structure "Place" offers the type as subUnitType = Gebaeude in P@C ServiceQualification.
